009package imagingbook.common.geometry.line;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012
013public abstract class Utils {
014        
015        /**
016         * This is a brute-force drawing method which simply marks all image pixels that
017         * are sufficiently close to the HoughLine hl. The drawing color for ip must be
018         * previously set.
019         *  @param line the line to be drawn.
020         * @param ip the {@link ImageProcessor} instance to draw to.
021         * @param thickness the thickness of the lines to be drawn.
022         */
023        public static void draw(AlgebraicLine line, ImageProcessor ip, double thickness) {
024                final int w = ip.getWidth();
025                final int h = ip.getHeight();
026                final double dmax = 0.5 * thickness;
027                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
028                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
029                                // get the distance between (u,v) and the line hl:
030                                double d = line.getDistance(u, v);
031                                if (d <= dmax) {
032                                        ip.drawPixel(u, v);
033                                }
034                        }
035                }
036        }
037        
038
039}
